quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Drama
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which sci-fi comedy features a character who renames himself Johnny 5?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Short Circuit

questions.question: In this cult film directed by John Carpenter both Clint Eastwood and Jack Nicholson were considered for the lead role.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big Trouble in Little China

questions.question: The 1994 animated movie The Lion King was inspired by this play by William Shakespeare.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hamlet

questions.question: What Academy Award-winning actor voiced Sheriff Woody in the 1995 animated movie Toy Story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Hanks

questions.question: What must the Beast do in order to become human again in the 1991 animated movie Beauty and the Beast?

options.text: Sacrifice his life for a loved one
Find a woman who will love him back

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Find a woman who will love him back

questions.question: Awarded with Best Picture from the Independent Spirit Awards, this drama is based on the murder of 14-year-old Marcy Renee Conrad.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rivers Edge

questions.question: What princess does the Magic Mirror present to Lord Farquaad as a perfect bride choice in the 2001 animated movie Shrek?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What record did the 1937 animated movie Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs set?

options.text: It was the first full-length feature film be produced by Walt Disney.
It was the first full-length celluloid-animated feature film.
It was the first full-length feature film produced in full color.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What 1950 animated Walt Disney film, based on a fairy tale by Charles Perrault, featured the songs A Dream Is a Wish Your Heart Makes, So This Is Love, Sing Sweet Nightingale, The Work Song, and the Oscar-nominated Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cinderella

questions.question: Which of these was not included in the 1940 Walt Disney animated movie Fantasia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dialogue

questions.question: Walt Disneys 1942 animated movie Bambi caused a phenomenon called the Bambi effect. What is it related to?

options.text: Children who become independent at young age

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Feeling sympathy for animals

questions.question: This animated film was produced by Steven Spielbergs Amblin Entertainment. The films main character became a mascot for UNICEF.

options.text: The Adventures of the American Rabbit

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An American Tail

questions.question: Who turns Pinocchio into a real boy in the 1940 animated Disney movie Pinocchio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Blue Fairy

questions.question: This drama is set in 1952 and is listed as the 4th best sports film of all time by the American Film Institute.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hoosiers

questions.question: This movie was directed by Martin Scorsese. It was nominated for several Academy Awards but received two thumbs down from Siskel and Ebert.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Color of Money

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Fight Club and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, cronenberg, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which 1986 sci-fi film directed by David Cronenberg is a remake of a 1958 film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fly

questions.question: What Fight Club character utters the line, have you ever heard a death rattle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marla

questions.question: When was the western movie High Noon released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1952

questions.question: What is the name of the gangster who intrudes upon the Fight Club meeting in the movie Fight Club?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou

questions.question: In which fantasy-action film directed by Russell Mulcahy, the main character was born in the village of Glenfinnan on the shores of Loch Shiel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Highlander

questions.question: Who played Amy Fowler Kane, Kanes new wife in the film High Noon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grace Kelly

questions.question: What does Tyler want to do at the beginning and the end of the movie Fight Club?

options.text: Become the President of the United States
Blow up the TRW and Credit Card company buildings

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blow up the TRW and Credit Card company buildings

questions.question: Where does Jack hit Tyler in the first swing of their first fight in the film Fight Club?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ear

questions.question: What is the seventh rule of Fight Club?

options.text: You dont talk about Fight Club.
When someone says stop or goes limp, the fight is over.
Fights go on as long as they have to.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fights go on as long as they have to.

questions.question: In the movie High Noon, Amy Fowler Kane heard rumors about Wills possible dalliances with a local woman. Which actress played this woman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katy Jurado

questions.question: What does the store clerk in the movie Fight Club want to be?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A veterinarian

questions.question: Who starred as Marshall Will Kane in High Noon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gary Cooper

questions.question: Which of these movies was the first box-office success for director Francis Ford Coppola since Apocalypse Now?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peggy Sue Got Married

questions.question: What automobile manufacturer does Jack work for in the movie Fight Club?

options.text: The one you just purchased a car from

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A major one

questions.question: This comedy-drama was written and directed by Woody Allen and was his biggest box office hit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannah and Her Sisters

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and High Noon
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, leader, dollar. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How old was Top Dollar from the movie The Crow, when his father told him that childhoods over the moment you know youre gonna die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Five

questions.question: In the western High Noon, after several minutes of shooting, Will Kane has killed two of Millers three henchmen. Who kills the last one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amy

questions.question: Eric Dravens war paint in The Crow is stylized to look like the mask he and Shelly used to play with together.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the movie The Crow, how many knives did Tin-Tin throw at Eric before being foiled by his own blade?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three

questions.question: Which of the following actors were not in the movie The Crow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christian Slater

questions.question: Why were Eric and Shelly killed in The Crow?

options.text: Top Dollar had a grudge against Eric.
Because of Top Dollars tenant relocation program.
The villain crew saw Shelly and followed her home to rape her and killed Eric to get him out of the way.
The villain crew saw Erics performance one night and they hated guitarists.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of Top Dollars tenant relocation program.

questions.question: Which three actors played the members of Fred Millers gang in the western movie High Noon?

options.text: Otto Kruger, Morgan Farley, Dale Robertson
Shep Wooley, Lee Van Cleef, Robert J. Wilke
Thomas Mitchell, Ian McHenry, Vincent Fleming
Harry Morgan, Lon Chaney, Jr., Lloyd Bridges

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shep Wooley, Lee Van Cleef, Robert J. Wilke

questions.question: What is the name of the  town in which the movie High Noon is set?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hadleyville, New Mexico territory

questions.question: What is the name of the theme song from High Noon?

options.text: Do Not Foresake Me Oh My Darling

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Do Not Foresake Me Oh My Darling

questions.question: Who portrayed gang leader Frank Miller in High Noon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ian MacDonald

questions.question: In the film The Crow, what was in the snow-globe Top Dollar was looking at as he reminisced with Myca over their father?

options.text: A large black cathedral, bearing gargoyles and spires
A miniature version of the city, dark with nightfall
A small cemetery, full of headstones and dead trees
A single stone cross, cracked and overgrown with moss

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A small cemetery, full of headstones and dead trees

questions.question: In the next  to the last scene of the movie High Noon, Miller has caught Amy and demands that Will  come out into the open or he will kill her. How does the scene end?

options.text: She scratches his eyes, escapes and Will kills him.
She marries Prince Ranier and lives happily ever after.
She kicks him in the shins, escapes and Will kills him.
She stabs him and then Will kills him.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She scratches his eyes, escapes and Will kills him.

questions.question: Who wrote the music for the movie High Noon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dimitri Tiomkin

questions.question: Who played Deputy Marshall Harvey Pell in High Noon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lloyd Bridges

questions.question: Which member of the High Noon crew was blacklisted because of the McCarthy hearings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The director

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, hoffman. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Robert Downey, Jr. became the first actor to be nominated for an Academy Award for the portrayal of a previous Oscar nominee. What actor did he portray in a 1992 movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlie Chaplin

questions.question: What was the first movie for which Dustin Hoffman received an Academy Award for Best Actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kramer vs. Kramer

questions.question: In the movie The Crow,Top Dollar and Myca smoked human tongues to get high, because All the power in the world resides in the tongue, my friend. Sometimes, theyre more useful than the person who bears them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the film The Crow, what was the name of the detective officer, with whom  Albrecht had repeated conflicts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Torres

questions.question: The portrayal of what Shakespearean character brought Laurence Olivier an Academy Award for Best Actor in 1948?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hamlet

questions.question: What was the importance of the actual crow in the movie The Crow?

options.text: The crow was actually Erics soul.
The crow was his familys emblem.
The crow was Erics link between the land of the living and of the dead.
The crow was just a weird bird that followed him around.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The crow was Erics link between the land of the living and of the dead.

questions.question: Why did Top Dollar have a tenant relocation program in the movie The Crow?

options.text: The program was meant to drive down real estate prices, so Top Dollar could buy everything in the neighborhood, fix it back up, stop all the crime, and resell the real estate.
Because he had to allow his henchmen to do some random crime, because the fun of being bad is what kept them loyal to him.
The program was meant to keep the neighborhood in fear.
The program aimed at blackmailing large real estate owners.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The program was meant to drive down real estate prices, so Top Dollar could buy everything in the neighborhood, fix it back up, stop all the crime, and resell the real estate.

questions.question: For which of these movies has Jack Nicholson not won an Oscar either for Best Actor or for Best Supporting Actor?

options.text: One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chinatown

questions.question: Originally, Top Dollar was not lead man in the crime ring going on in the dark city in the film The Crow. After some budget cuts, time constraints, and the tragic loss of Brandon Lee, the screenplay was rewritten to feature Top Dollar as top dog. Who was the original boss?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lau

questions.question: Why did Marlon Brando decline his second Academy Award for Best Actor, which he won for the 1972 movie The Godfather?

options.text: He said he didnt deserve it.
He believed the distribution of the awards was fixed.
He was against the way Native Americans were portrayed by the media.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was against the way Native Americans were portrayed by the media.

questions.question: Robert De Niro won his first Academy Award for Best Actor for his performance in this movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raging Bull

questions.question: Why was Officer Albrecht from The Crow demoted from Detective to Beat Cop?

options.text: He was caught ogling children at a school crosswalk.
He was a loose cannon, and just broke the rules too many times.
He stuck his nose in too deep to the case when Eric and Shelly were murdered.
He beat up another detective after catching him in bed with his wife.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He stuck his nose in too deep to the case when Eric and Shelly were murdered.

questions.question: In the film The Crow, Erics call sign is a stylized bird, presumably a crow. How did Eric make his call-sign after killing Tin-Tin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In blood, on the wall

questions.question: Which of these actors set a record for most Best Actor Oscar nominations without winning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter OToole

questions.question: The portrayal of which of these characters brought Tom Hanks an Academy Award for Best Actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Beckett

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Soylent Green and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, fiction, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When was the science fiction movie Soylent Green released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1973

questions.question: Much of the Soylent Greens music came from classical composers. Which of these composers’ music was not used on the movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wagner

questions.question: What movie earned Sean Penn his first Academy Award for Best Actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mystic River

questions.question: The new food products in Soylent Green are called Soylent Yellow, Red, and Green. The term soylent comes from two foods. One is soy bean. What is the other?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lentils

questions.question: Who is the director of the science fiction movie Soylent Green?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Fleischer

questions.question: According to Soylent Green’s storyline, what were educated people called in 2022?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Books

questions.question: People can be voluntarily euthanised in the world depicted in Soylent Green. How is euthanasia referred to in the movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Going home

questions.question: What is the name of the book on which Soylent Green was based?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Make Room! Make Room!

questions.question: How were women referred to in New York City of 2022 in Soylent Green?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Furniture

questions.question: In the science fiction Soylent Green, who starred as Detective Robert Thorn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlton Heston

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a Michael Moore documentary?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An Inconvenient Truth

questions.question: Tab Fielding is a corporate/government murderer in Soylent Green. Who plays this character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck Conners

questions.question: As depicted in the Soylent Green science fiction movie, what was not a reason for the food crisis in 2022?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Volcanic explosions

questions.question: Which statement is not true about Soylent Green?

options.text: Because he had a southern accent, Mike Henrys part had to be dubbed.
Orson Welles acting role in the movie was shortened to six lines.
Sol is euthanized because he learns what soylent green is and because he has terminal cancer.
There is a band called Soilent Green.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orson Welles acting role in the movie was shortened to six lines.

questions.question: This actor won his first Academy Award for Best Actor for portraying painter and writer Christy Brown in the 1989 movie My Left Foot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Day-Lewis

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Documentary and Graduate
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, college, hoffman. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Star Wars character General Grievous is always accompanied by 2 magna guards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Wordplay is a documentary about  Will Shortz the cross word puzzle editor for the New York Times and people who love the challenge of crossword puzzles.  What do you call a person who creates crossword puzzles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Enigmatologist

questions.question: The Blue Senate Guards, that first appear in Star Wars: Episode 1, are armed with what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blaster Rifles

questions.question: How old was recent college graduate Benjamin at the beginning of The Graduate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 20

questions.question: Timothy Treadwell made the brown bears in Alaskas Katmai National Park his passion and obsession.  For thirteen summers he lived among the bears, to the disapproval of the park rangers, filming and writing about them. In 2003 a brown bear attacked Treadwell and his girlfriend, Amie Huguenard, killing and devouring both.  Using Timothy Treadwels footage and interviews with his friends, Werner Herzog, made this documentary about Treadwells life.

options.text: you know the name of this film?
The Bears of Katmai National Park

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grizzly Man

questions.question: The Maysles Brothers captured on the film  Gimme Shelter   what many wrote was  the end of the  Woodstock Nation.  On December 6, 1969, the Rolling Stones played a free concert at the Altamont Speedway.  Unfortunately, the Hells Angels were asked to be in charge of security.  What song were the Stones singing when Meredith Hunter was stabbed and kicked to death by the Hells Angels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Under My Thumb

questions.question: What documentary features rugby playing quadriplegics going full tilt boogie for the gold at the 2004 Paraolympic games in Athens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Murderball

questions.question: How old was Dustin Hoffman at the time of filming of The Graduate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 29

questions.question: This documentary has been called  a punk Last Waltz.  It featured this group from their beginnings at the fabled New York City bar CBGB to their induction in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.  What group starred in  Turn of the Century ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ramones

questions.question: George Lucas makes a cameo appearance in Episode 3 of Star Wars as which character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baron Papanoida

questions.question: Does Lando make a threatening move toward Han Solo in Star Wars: Episode 5?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What was the name of the character played by Dustin Hoffman in The Graduate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benjamin Braddock

questions.question: What six times winner of the Mr. Olympia crown is featured in  Pumping Iron  ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arnold Schwarzenegger

questions.question: In what year was the movie The Graduate released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1967

questions.question: How did fictional character Han Solo win the Millennium Falcon?

options.text: He won it in a sabacc game.
He won it in a bet.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He won it in a sabacc game.
